column4: Anyone here familiar with setting up a pptp connection in Kubuntu?
ask questions, don't ask to ask
are you doing peerdns or something?
like i asked before, are you using peerdns or anything?
and do you have the right static route set up to whatever network you are connecting to
and where are the resolvers located physically?
on your network segment or the network segment that you are connecting to
ok, and do you have the proper static route set up?
you need static route set up to route to the new network
i mean basic cross segment networking.
a static route that maps the IPs of the network segment you are connecting to to your local segment
well, in short, it changes my resolvers to the resolvers they should be, I can see the change when I cat /etc/resolv.conf
ok, so now add a static route so that the IPs that those resolves give you route to meaningful locations

if you have dns, a pptp connection, and a route, then your connection works unless there are some extra limits/needs of your connection that are more than usual, and that is even more outside of the scope of this channel than this conversation already is
if you are routing to ltsp on windows or something you'll probably need to enable windows specific options.  Covered in pretty much every pptp tutorial i've ever seen
